content: It's hard. Cattle prices are volatile, input costs are insane, and the weather's getting more extreme. Every year is a fight.
participant_profile: M, 62, Cattle rancher, fifth-generation, 4,000 acres, conservative
preceding_moderator_q: Thank you for making time. Tell me about life in rural Montana today.

content: I'm 35, took over the family place. My grandparents had an easier time of it. We're barely hanging on some years.
participant_profile: M, 35, Young rancher, took over family operation, concerned about future
preceding_moderator_q: Thank you for making time. Tell me about life in rural Montana today.

content: Wheat prices are okay but fuel, fertilizer, equipment - costs have doubled in ten years. Margins are razor thin.
participant_profile: M, 48, Wheat farmer, diversified operation, pragmatic politics
preceding_moderator_q: Thank you for making time. Tell me about life in rural Montana today.

content: The community is shrinking. Young people leave. The school is half what it was when our kids were there.
participant_profile: F, 55, Rancher's wife, runs the books, community volunteer
preceding_moderator_q: Thank you for making time. Tell me about life in rural Montana today.

content: I drive 200 miles some days to see animals. The distances out here are hard for people to understand.
participant_profile: F, 41, Veterinarian, large animal practice, serves whole county
preceding_moderator_q: Thank you for making time. Tell me about life in rural Montana today.

content: At the post office I see who's left. Fewer ranches, fewer families. It's quiet.
participant_profile: F, 58, Town postmaster, knows everyone, swing voter
preceding_moderator_q: Thank you for making time. Tell me about life in rural Montana today.

content: When I was ranching actively, there were five families on this road. Now it's two. The land consolidated.
participant_profile: M, 71, Retired rancher, sold to kids, longtime Republican
preceding_moderator_q: Thank you for making time. Tell me about life in rural Montana today.

content: My business depends on these ranches. Fewer ranches, fewer customers. Simple math.

content: Stay out of our way mostly. But also - fair trade policies, reasonable regulations, infrastructure.

content: Water rights that make sense. The Forest Service and BLM need to understand agriculture.

content: Internet. We still have terrible internet. Hard to run a modern business without it.

content: Rural healthcare. The nearest hospital is 90 miles. That's life or death.

content: Don't make it harder to do business. That's all I ask.
